properties.name: Burj Dubai
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227Dubai, United Arab EmiratesBurj Dubai is a skyscraper currently being built in Dubai, United Arab Emirates. When finished in 2009, the building is predicted to be over 2,600 ft. tall. So far it has already become the tallest building on Earth. The only structure that surpasses it for now is the KVLY-TV mast in North Dakota, which stands just over 2,000 ft. tall. Burj Dubai will offer living areas for the wealthy. Plans are being made to build an area nearby called "Downtown Dubai", which will include the largest shopping mall in the world. Dubai has other interesting places nearby to visit. They have one of the world\'s largest indoor ski resorts and the Burj Al Arab, the tallest hotel in the world.

properties.name: Machu Picchu
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227Machu Picchu, Peru Machu Picchu is an ancient Inca site located over the Urubamba Valley in Peru. It is thought to have been built in 1450 and was rediscovered in 1911 by Hiram Bingham. The ruins attracted 400,000 tourists in 2003. Archaeologists believe the Incas chose Machu Picchu\'s location because of its positioning with the sky and stars. The Intihuatana Stone, for example, points straight at the winter solstice. Concerns over tourism have occurred, however. Tourists are damaging the site by peeling off pieces of the ruins. Plans to build more entrances into the ruins have been protested.

properties.name: Serengeti National Park
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227  Serengeti National Park is a very large park in Tanzania. The park spans just under 13,000 square kilometers. It contains 200,000 zebra, 500,000 gazelle, and over 2 million wildebeest. It also holds the largest migrations happening semiannually. The animals migrate in a clockwise path. They stay at the south end of the park during winter and spring. During the summer and fall, they move towards the north end of the park. This park is one of the many tourist attractions in Tanzania. Tanzania currently receives over 700,000 tourists a year.

properties.name: Taj Mahal
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227India The Taj Mahal is one of the world\'s most well known mausoleums. It is one of the New Seven Wonders of the World and located in Agra, India. It is well known for its large marble dome and its architectural beauty. Two to three million tourists visit yearly. The Taj Mahal was built by Shah Jahan. He wanted to build an elaborate tomb for his wife, Mumtaz Mahal. It took 22 years to complete. An extra tomb was built inside the Taj Mahal when Shah Jahan died 20 years later.

properties.name: The Eiffel Tower
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227Paris The Eiffel TowerThe Eiffel Tower is a world-reknown structure in Paris, France. It is 1,063 ft. tall, being the tallest building in the city. The iron structure was designed by Gustave Eiffel. Construction started in 1887 and ended in 1889. The Eiffel Tower has some attractions. It has two restaurants. They are named the Jules Verne and Altitude 95. One of the legs of the structure holds a museum based on how the elevators in the tower work. The very top of the tower is the highest public location in Europe.

properties.name: The Golden Gate Bridge
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227Golden Gate Bridge The Golden Gate Bridge is a bridge connecting the city of San Francisco to Marin County in California. The bridge has a main span of 4,200 feet, and has the second longest main span for a bridge in the U.S. It is one of San Francisco\'s main tourist attraction. Its unique orange color has helped it become known globally. Construction began on January 5, 1933. Before the bridge was built, the only way across was by ferry. Leading the project was Joseph Strauss. The bridge was finally finished on April 27, 1937.

properties.name: The Ice Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227 Jukkasjärvi, SwedenThe Ice Hotel is a hotel that is built near Kiruna, Sweden. It is the first hotel to be built entirely out of ice. There are more than 80 rooms and even a church. The hotel must be built each year and only stands from December to April. The hotel was built for the first time in 1990 by Jannot Derid. He built an igloo as an exhibition for his art. Some visitors came and asked if they could sleep inside of it since there were no rooms in the village nearby, which started the Ice Hotel idea. Prices for rooms vary between 00-00 a night.

properties.name: The Pyramids Of Giza
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227The Pyramids of Giza are pyramids located near Cairo, Egypt. The Pyramid of Khufu (also known as The Great Pyramid) is the only remaining Wonder of the Seven Ancient Wonders of the World. They were built to bury Pharaohs and queens. Millions of tourists visit them yearly. Part of The Pyramids of Giza is The Great Sphinx. This world known statue is 241 feet long and 65 feet high. It looks like a lion with a human face. The sphinx is thought to have been built by the Egyptians around 2500 B.C.

properties.name: Times Square
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast2271588 Broadway, New York, NYTimes Square is an intersection in New York City. It is well known around the world for its bright digital advertisements. The junction of Broadway and Seventh Avenue occurs here. It has so many signs that it comes close to the amount of signs in Las Vegas. During New Year\'s Eve, Times Square holds the largest celebration in the U.S. The celebration is broadcast to all of the U.S. Times Square drops a ball to comemmorate the new year. During this time there are plenty of live performances from hundreds of different musical artists.

properties.name: Venice
properties.description: Posted by Tsaxbeast227Venice, ItalyVenice is a city in Italy that is a very popular tourist attraction. It is located on 110 small islands in the Adriatic Sea. It is well known for its 150 different canals running through it. The city also has more than 400 bridges. Venice attracts tourists not only because of its canals, but also because of its unique structures and its squares. The Piazza San Marco is one of the many well-known squares. Facing the Piazza San Marco is Doge\'s Palace, a beautiful palace built in 1309. Other famous places include the Rialto Bridge, the Grand Canal, and St. Mark\'s Church.
